text.__SUMMARY__: Quercus litseoides is an uncommon Asian species of trees in the beech family. It has been found only in southern China, in the Provinces of Guangdong and Guangxi.Quercus litseoides is a tree up to 10 meters tall. Leaves can be as much as 7 cm long.The epithet "litseoides" refers to a resemblance between this tree and Litsea chinensis, now called Litsea glutinosa.
